body:
### JUnit 5 - `documentation` as modular test
```
java
--show-version
--show-module-resolution
--module-path {...}
--add-modules documentation
--module org.junit.platform.console
--scan-modules
--include-classname .*Tests
--include-classname .*Demo
--exclude-tag exclude
```
- test run module resolution https://gist.github.com/sormuras/9cb94d59805b1435f6e80de2776cf128
- test run tree https://gist.github.com/sormuras/9ce9155988cf2166b0ac28299aa18d48

```
28 containers failed
20 tests failed
```

issue.title: Java module descriptor for `org.assertj.core`

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
### Old caption

`[ByteBuddy] NoClassDefFoundError: java.lang.instrument.Instrumentation`

#### Summary

Running tests included in JUnit 5's [documentation](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/tree/master/documentation/src/test/java) project (backing the User Guide) on the `class-path` works fine. Converting those tests and demos into a Java module and running it on the `module-path` fails with several errors. One of the error is related to AssertJ/ByteBuddy.

Found this issue while working on https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/1877

/cc @raphw 

```
  JUnit Jupiter:EngineTestKitAllEventsDemo:verifyAllJupiterEvents()
    MethodSource [className = 'example.testkit.EngineTestKitAllEventsDemo', methodName = 'verifyAllJupiterEvents', methodParameterTypes = '']
    => java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Could not create type
       org.assertj.core@3.12.2/org.assertj.core.internal.bytebuddy.TypeCache.findOrInsert(TypeCache.java:154)
       org.assertj.core@3.12.2/org.assertj.core.internal.bytebuddy.TypeCache$WithInlineExpunction.findOrInsert(TypeCache.java:365)
       org.assertj.core@3.12.2/org.assertj.core.api.SoftProxies.createSoftAssertionProxyClass(SoftProxies.java:118)
       org.assertj.core@3.12.2/org.assertj.core.api.SoftProxies.createSoftAssertionProxy(SoftProxies.java:104)
       org.assertj.core@3.12.2/org.assertj.core.api.AbstractSoftAssertions.proxy(AbstractSoftAssertions.java:31)
       [...]
     Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java/lang/instrument/Instrumentation
       org.assertj.core@3.12.2/org.assertj.core.internal.bytebuddy.utility.JavaModule$Dispatcher$CreationAction.run(JavaModule.java:270)
       org.assertj.core@3.12.2/org.assertj.core.internal.bytebuddy.utility.JavaModule$Dispatcher$CreationAction.run(JavaModule.java:251)
       java.base/java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
       org.assertj.core@3.12.2/org.assertj.core.internal.bytebuddy.utility.JavaModule.<clinit>(JavaModule.java:45)
       org.assertj.core@3.12.2/org.assertj.core.internal.bytebuddy.dynamic.loading.ClassInjector$UsingReflection$Dispatcher$CreationAction.run(ClassInjector.java:454)
       [...]
     Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: java.lang.instrument.Instrumentation
       java.base/jdk.internal.loader.BuiltinClassLoader.loadClass(BuiltinClassLoader.java:583)
       java.base/jdk.internal.loader.ClassLoaders$AppClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoaders.java:178)
       java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:521)
       [...]
```

_Side note: Nice to see the AssertJ's version `3.12.2` compiled into its module! :+1:_

issue.title: Improve module descriptor directives

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Closes #1877

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [x] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass

body:
Hello, 
I have a question about personnal JUnit extension.
I created a JUnit extension in a maven plugin project and i want to use this plugin and also the JUnit extension in another  project but i have no idea haw can i manage an export and import dependencies of the maven plugin and also his JUnit extension!
Thank you for help!

@Mamadou59 This issue tracker is usually not the best place to get answers to such questions. I think if you post this question on StackOverflow you're far more likely to get a helpful answer. Having said that, assuming your custom extension is in the test source folder, you should be able to [build a test-jar](https://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-jar-plugin/examples/create-test-jar.html) and consume it in the other project.

### Definition of Done
